definitions.definition: that makes you pay attention to it because it is so interesting and exciting

examples.text: Her latest book makes compelling reading.

definitions.definition: so strong that you cannot resist it

examples.text: He was a sad man with a compelling need to talk about his unhappiness.

definitions.definition: that makes you think it is true

examples.text: There is no compelling reason to believe him.
The new studies provide compelling evidence in support of these concepts.
The logic of this point of view is not compelling and is not supported by the data.
There is no logically compelling argument to support their claims.
